examples: After all, one case of the trots hardly spells disaster.
Every age has its book, after all.
After all, love will find a way.
After all, an electrical brain is smarter than the sum of its parts.
A new broom sweeps clean, after all.
words.defineEn: at a later time
words.defineVi: sau đó

examples: Get real!
Get real!
Is your jacket real leather?
Her last book was a real money-spinner.
You are a real grouch.
words.defineEn: extremely or very
words.defineVi: cực kỳ hoặc rất

examples: His opinions are entirely beyond the pale.
The recent economic recovery was almost entirely led by exports.
I entirely agree with you.
She made the suggestions entirely off her own bat.
The energy company's board of directors was composed entirely of men in gray suits who were resistant to investing in renewable energy sources.
words.defineEn: completely or to the full extent
words.defineVi: hoàn toàn hoặc đến mức đầy đủ

examples: ways to save money on heating bills.
Ways to save money on heating bills.
Way to start Carol!
After all, love will find a way.
A bit of good fortune came my way.
words.defineEn: used to emphasize the amount or intensity of something
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nhấn mạnh số lượng hoặc cường độ của một cái gì đó

examples: Our progress has been fairly slow so far, but it's early days.
She makes a point of treating her employees fairly.
Cornish homeowners wonder if they are being fairly served
I don’t think I was fairly treated, but then that’s life, isn’t it?

In a business, when employers treat their employees fairly and provide opportunities for growth and development, it can lead to a more motivated and dedicated workforce, as good masters make good servants.
words.defineEn: more than average, but not too much
words.defineVi: hơn mức trung bình, nhưng không quá nhiều

examples: These foods are potentially dangerous, yet nobody thinks twice before handing them out to their loved ones.
Cycling is potentially very dangerous in the city - you have to have all your wits about you.
Biden White House with a Democratic Congress will enable tax reform, a large covid package in the first quarter, health care reform potentially.
A disc 100 meters across would potentially reveal details like plasma exchanges between stars in the Alpha Centauri system, our closest neighbors.
And oceans like theirs could potentially support life, too.
words.defineEn: with the capability to develop into something or happen in the future
words.defineVi: với khả năng phát triển thành một cái gì đó hoặc xảy ra trong tương lai

examples: A work ill done must be twice done.
"I've done twice as much today as yesterday!"
You won't have to explain it to him twice.
These foods are potentially dangerous, yet nobody thinks twice before handing them out to their loved ones.
The dentist recommended that I brush my teeth twice a day and floss regularly.
words.defineEn: for two times
words.defineVi: hai lần

examples: John shook his head as another corporation was fined a relatively small amount for environmental damage and safety violations.
I constantly have to remind myself that the worst wheel of the cart creaks most, checking my tendency to complain when relatively minor difficulties arise in my life.
The shift to corporate lobbying is relatively new.
The premise of the program is relatively simple.
The profits in this industry are relatively obscene.
words.defineEn: to a specific degree, particularly when compared to other similar things
words.defineVi: ở một mức độ cụ thể, đặc biệt là khi so sánh với những thứ tương tự khác

examples: The film looks likely to offend many people.
This move is likely to raise alarm bells with the French government.
The proposals are likely to mean another hundred closures.
Capital spending this year is likely to hit $1,800 million.
"That's a likely story!"
words.defineEn: used to show that something may be the case or may happen
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để chỉ ra rằng một cái gì đó có thể là trường hợp hoặc có thể xảy ra

examples: Working with sheep comes naturally to sheepdogs.
Naturally, it allowed him to feather his nest over the years.
Some people are just naturally good at math, and no amount of practice can change that because it's a case of born, not made.
The coach believed that nature passes nurture, and that some athletes are just naturally more talented than others, regardless of their training and practice.
Many people assume that men are naturally better at sports, but time and time again, female athletes have proven that the gray mare is the better horse, often outperforming their male counterparts.
words.defineEn: as is expected
words.defineVi: như mong đợi

examples: She felt her mother's death very deeply.
We were deeply moved by her plight.
They are falling deeper into debt, and there is no light at the end of the tunnel.
I often have vivid dreams when I sleep deeply.
As a teacher, I encourage my students to think deeply and critically before asking questions, reminding them that 'a fool may ask more questions in an hour than a wise man can answer in seven years.'
words.defineEn: to a great degree; very much
words.defineVi: đến một mức độ tuyệt vời; rất nhiều

examples: These reforms will produce little change.
This room gets very little sunshine.
Surprisingly, the little café had the best coffee in town.
The little café had, surprisingly, the best coffee in town.
These discussions held little interest for Lucy.
words.defineEn: to a small extent or degree
words.defineVi: đến một mức độ nhỏ hoặc mức độ

examples: I see things differently now.
I look at tennis differently from some coaches.
They always claim to be wise after the event, offering their opinions on what should have been done differently.
The man grew up in a household with abusive parents, but he was determined to break the cycle and raise his own children differently, knowing that a bad tree does not yield good apples.
Once she started to show, people started treating her differently.
words.defineEn: in a way that is different
words.defineVi: theo một cách khác

examples: She doesn't eat properly.
There aren't enough staff to watch him properly.
Failing to properly maintain the equipment could spell disaster for the entire operation.
Mary wanted to run a marathon without training properly, but her coach warned her that it was idle to swallow the cow and choke on the tail.
If I could wave my magic wand, I would just make it so the pipe had been installed properly in the first place.
words.defineEn: in a correct or satisfactory way
words.defineVi: một cách chính xác hoặc thỏa đáng

examples: Current drilling technology thus barely scrapes the surface.
The story of her life, thus far, has been being in the right place at the right time.
The CEO of the company knew that no truth, no crown, and thus made sure that the company always operated with honesty and integrity.
It’s as if Google is just so big now, the left hand doesn’t know what the right is doing, and thus different teams keep coming up with the same products.
Thus ends that experiment, now back to the show.
words.defineEn: as a result
words.defineVi: kết quả là

examples: The shopkeeper closed the shop for a short break.
The police closed in.
The business has already closed the books for this quarter.
Detectives had closed the book on the Hornsey Murders case three years previously.
The library closes early on Sundays.
words.defineEn: without much space between
words.defineVi: không có nhiều khoảng cách giữa

examples: Spring came late this year.
Her latest novel takes the lid off the international art world.
The government's latest proposals are a dog's dinner.
She was only five minutes late!
The latest smartphone is now on the market.
words.defineEn: after the usual or expected time
words.defineVi: sau thời gian bình thường hoặc dự kiến

examples: Most characters in his movies are somewhat larger than life.
As a single person, you're somewhat of a third wheel when traveling with couples.
Their efforts to improve quality have somewhat missed the mark.
When I asked my grandfather how much sleep he got each night, he replied, 'six hours' sleep for a man, seven for a woman, and eight for a fool,' which I found surprising and somewhat offensive.
Somewhat happened.
words.defineEn: to a moderate degree or extent
words.defineVi: ở một mức độ vừa phải hoặc mức độ

examples: Well technically not that easy as it sounds.
This house is technically a hazardous waste site.
We have a tough time technically.
But technically, lots of things in space can cause gravitational waves.
So technically, they have natural sources.
words.defineEn: in accordance with an exact understanding of facts, rules, etc. or their literal interpretation
words.defineVi: phù hợp với sự hiểu biết chính xác về các sự kiện, quy tắc, v.v. hoặc giải thích theo nghĩa đen của chúng

examples: Originally we were going to buy John's old car, but we thought better of it.
We find guys like Bjorn Sundin, originally from Sweden, and his partner in crime, also listed on the INTERPOL wanted pages.
Originally, these laptops just accessed the internet via Google's Chrome browser, nothing else.
Now the marquee above us was originally, of course, an analog marquee, and--
The Cherokee people are originally from the Eastern Woodlands area.
words.defineEn: in a way that relates to the beginning or source of something
words.defineVi: trong một cách có liên quan đến sự khởi đầu hoặc nguồn gốc của một cái gì đó

examples: The chef carefully arranged the arugula leaves on the plate as a beautiful garnish.
The child carefully planted caryopses of wildflowers in the garden.
The lioness carefully groomed her newborn baby.
Please drive carefully.
She carefully sprinkled sunflower seeds on top of her homemade bread dough.
words.defineEn: with a lot of care or attention
words.defineVi: với rất nhiều quan tâm hoặc chú ý

examples: Carpenters roughly shape the figurine with a band saw.
35 is right there roughly.
Log base 2 of 8000 is roughly 13.
So the earthquake was roughly over here.
A 10% movement would be roughly there.
words.defineEn: approximately; without being exact
words.defineVi: khoảng; mà không chính xác

examples: Guys automatically become less attractive when they break Priscian's head.
The closet had a light that automatically turned on when the door was opened.
All your recent searches are automatically saved.
When the sun rises, the curtains in my room open automatically.
Automatically picked up HDR10 mode.
words.defineEn: with no reflection or thinking
words.defineVi: không có suy nghĩ hay suy nghĩ

examples: The attorney general oversees, obviously, the Department of Justice, but importantly, immigration is federal in this country.
But more importantly, the incidents damaged Chipotle's reputation with customers.
But more importantly, that analysis ignores religious motivations.
Most importantly, follow the advice of your local emergency management officials.
Most importantly not all trouble is pathologic.
words.defineEn: used to highlight an important point
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để làm nổi bật một điểm quan trọng

examples: We have to look at nightmares very delicately.
The caterpillars delicately spin threads to create their cocoons, and it can take hundreds of silkworms to make a kilo of silk.
Cashmere softness means that it needs to be treated delicately throughout the whole process.
Spacecraft at these points are like balls on a hilltop: They’ll stay if they’re delicately balanced or if you hold them, but the slightest breeze will send them speeding downhill.
You can criticize artwork, but it should be carefully researched, well considered, and delicately executed.
words.defineEn: done in a careful and gentle manner and with paying attention to details
words.defineVi: được thực hiện một cách cẩn thận và nhẹ nhàng và chú ý đến các chi tiết
